quotes.quote: Boredom is the root of all evil--the despairing refusal to be oneself.
Boredom is a disease of the mind and psyche, an insidious disease. It not only takes the joy out of life, but the creativity as well. No one of God's children should ever be bored with life.
Life is never boring, but some people choose to be bored.
Grasp your opportunities, no matter how poor your health; nothing is worse for your health than boredom.
Boredom is a sickness the cure for which is work; pleasure is only a palliative.
Boredom flourishes too, when you feel safe. It's a symptom of security.
You'll find boredom where there is the absence of a good idea.
Running through things because you are familiar with them, breeds routine and this is the seed of boredom.
In order to live free and happily you must sacrifice boredom. It is not always an easy sacrifice.
Boredom rests upon the nothingness that winds its way through existence; its giddiness, like that which comes from gazing down into an infinite abyss, is infinite.
Boredom is the self being stuffed with itself.
Boredom is nothing but the experience of a paralysis of our productive powers.
Boredom is the conviction that you can't change'the shriek of unused capacities.
Boredom is the fear of self.
Boredom is the deadliest poison.
The concept of boredom entails an inability to use up present moments in a personally fulfilling way.
Boredom is the dream bird that hatches the egg of experience. A rustling in the leaves drives him away.
The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
Boredom: the desire for desires.
Boredom comes from a boring mind.
Perhaps the world's second worst crime is boredom. The first is being a bore.
I always think boredom is to some extent the fault of the bored.
Boredom is rage spread thin.
Boredom is a sign of satisfied ignorance, blunted apprehension, crass sympathies, dull understanding, feeble powers of attention, and irreclaimable weakness of character.
Boredom is the feeling that everything is a waste of time; serenity, that nothing is.
I can excuse everything but boredom. Boring people don't have to stay that way.
When we hold back out of laziness, that is when we tie ourselves into knots of boredom.
Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist, since half the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
